member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Marker
member.summary:
Represents a marker pointing to a position in a document relative to a specific .
The marker can point to a position at the start of an object (, at the end of an object (see , or to a position occupied by a whole childless object (.
If the marker belongs to a , it can be used even if its has been deleted.

member.summary: This instance and the other range represent the same range.

member.summary: This instance contains the other range and both have the same start, but different end locations.

member.summary: This instance contains the other range and both have the same end, but different start locations.

member.summary: This instance contains the other range, and both start and end of this instance are outside the other range.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.InsideStart
member.summary: This instance is inside the other range and both have the same start, but different end locations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.InsideEnd
member.summary: This instance is inside the other range and both have the same end, but different start locations.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.Inside
member.summary: This instance is inside the other range, and both start and end of this instance are inside the other range.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.AdjacentBefore
member.summary: This instance occurs before, and is adjacent to, the other range.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.OverlapsBefore
member.summary: This instance starts before the other range and overlaps its start.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LocationRelation.AdjacentAfter
member.summary: This instance occurs after, and is adjacent to, the other range.

member.summary: This instance occurs after the other range.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock
member.summary: Represents a building block in a document. A building block is pre-built content, similar to autotext, that may contain text, images, and formatting.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentBase)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The parent

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.Body
member.summary: Gets the building block content.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.ID
member.summary: Gets the a unique identifier that uniquely identifies this building block. This unique identifier can be used by an application to uniquely reference a single building block regardless of different naming, for example when the same part has different names for localization purposes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets a name for the contents of this building block. This name allows the building block to have a friendly identifier contained within the definition for this building block.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets the categorization for a building block. This categorization shall not imply any behaviors around the building block, and is only used to organize the set of building blocks within an application or user interface i.e. to disambiguate between two building blocks with the same entry name.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description for the contents of this building block. This description allows the building block to have additional information contained within the definition for this building block.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.BuiltIn
member.summary: Gets or sets that the name for the current building block is a built-in building block which should not be displayed in the user interface. This information can be used by an application as needed, for example, to disambiguate an building block from one with the same name, ensuring that the built-in building block can be uniquely identified by the application.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.Type
member.summary: Gets the the set of building block types. Each of these types can, based on their values, influence the visibility and behavior of the building block.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.InsertOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of insert options which shall be applied to the building block when it is added to the main document story. Since multiple insert options can be specified for a single building block, the sum total of all behaviors shall be used to insert the building block into the main document story.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the paragraph style which shall be associated with the current building block. This paragraph style associated shall not imply anything about the formatting or content of the building block, and shall only be used to filter and/or sort this building block (via an application or a user interface). One example of the level of classification offered by this property is to only show it as available when the formatting of the paragraph matches the specified style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.SaveOnlySection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to save the only section properties of the building block in output.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuildingBlock.StyleId
member.summary: Gets or sets the style ID for a paragraph style which shall be associated with the current building block. This paragraph style associated shall not imply anything about the formatting or content of the building block, and shall only be used to filter and/or sort this building block (via an application or a user interface). One example of the level of classification offered by this property is to only show it as available when the formatting of the paragraph matches the specified style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.Temporary
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the content control shall be removed from the document when the its contents are modified. This property is primarily intended for creating structured document tags whose sole purpose is one-time placeholder text, and which should not return once replaced with content. If false, then the content control shall not be automatically removed when its contents are modified. If true, then the wiil be reset to false.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.PlaceholderText
member.summary: Gets or sets the building block which shall be displayed in the content control when its run contents are empty. If this property is null, then five non-breaking spaces shall be used as the default placeholder text. This property has no effect if the property is .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.ShowingPlaceholderText
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the content of the control shall be interpreted to contain placeholder text for this content control (as opposed to regular text contents within the content control). If this property is true, this state shall be resumed (showing placeholder text) upon opening this document. If this property is false, then the content control shall not be interpreted to be showing placeholder text when the document is displayed. This property has no effect if the property is .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.XmlMapping
member.summary: Gets the information which shall be used to establish a mapping between a content control and an XML element stored within a Custom XML Data part in the document. This property has no effect if the property is .

member.summary: Gets or sets the relationship between the content control and an Office Web Extension.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.ParentControl
member.summary: Gets the parent content control.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.Content
member.summary: Gets the last known contents of the control. This contents shall be treated as a cache of the contents to be displayed in the control.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.Font
member.summary: Gets the font which shall be applied to the text of the content control in replacement of placeholder text. When placeholder text is present in a content control, its formatting is often different than the desired underlying formatting, and this property specifies the font which shall be used for non-placeholder text contents when they are initially added to the control.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.Style
member.summary: Gets or sets the style which shall be applied to the text of the content control in replacement of placeholder text. When placeholder text is present in a content control, its formatting is often different than the desired underlying formatting, and this property specifies the style which shall be used for non-placeholder text contents when they are initially added to the control.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.EndMark
member.summary: Gets the formatting which shall be applied to the mark present to delimit the end of the control contents.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.Color
member.summary: Gets the color on which to base the visual elements of the content control.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.MultiLine
member.summary: Gets or sets whether soft line breaks can be added to the contents of this control when this document is modified. This property shall not affect the ability of the control to display existing soft line breaks (which shall be preserved) and shall only affect the ability to add line breaks when the document is modified by an application. This property has effect only if the property is or .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.DropDownItems
member.summary: Gets the to display in content control if its type is or .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.AllowInsertDeleteSection
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow the insertion of new or deletion of old content control with type contained within this content control except when needed to maintain the numerical relation between the number of elements matched through data binding and the number of child content controls contained. This property has effect only for content controls with type .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.RepeatingSectionItemTitle
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name of the repeated section. This property has effect only for content controls with type .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.Date
member.summary: Gets or sets the date last entered into the content control. This cache is used because the date display mask stored on the property might not contain all of the information about the date, which might be needed if the date display mask is later changed. If this property is not null, then the current value shall be used to populate the content of the content control by filtering it through the date display mask specified in the property, if it's not null. This property has effect only for content controls with type .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.DateFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the display format which shall be used to format any date from the before displaying it in the control content. If this property is null, then the date shall be formatted using the standard date display mask for the language ID specified in the property if present, or the language ID of the run contents otherwise. This property has effect only for content controls with type .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.DateLocale
member.summary: Gets or sets the language ID which shall be used for displaying a calendar for the current date picker content control, if a user interface is present for the content control. If this property is null, then the language ID shall be the language ID of the run contents of the content control. This property has effect only for content controls with type .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.DateCalendar

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.DateStorageFormat

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.BuildingBlockGallery

A building block gallery is a classification of building blocks, which might then be subdivided into categories. This property has effect for content controls with type and .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControl.BuildingBlockCategory
member.summary: gets or sets the category of building blocks which shall be used as the filter when determining the possible choices of building blocks which are displayed for insertion into the content control. A building block category is a sub-classification within a given building block gallery which can be used to further categorize the parts in a given gallery. If value is null, then the content control shall display all building blocks in the specified gallery regardless their specified category. This property has effect for content controls with type and .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DropDownItemCollection.SelectedValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the value associated with the current display text for the content control. If this content control is not mapped to XML using the property, then this property shall be ignored. If this content control is mapped to XML, it shall be used to determine whether the current display text in the content control shall be retained when the document is opened, as follows: When the XML mapping is created, the content in the custom XML data is retrieved. If this content has an associated list item (matching its value property), then the corresponding display text shall be displayed in the content control. If no list item exists, this content shall be matched against this property value. If the values match, the current display text shall be retained. If the values do not match, the current custom XML data content shall be the new display text (since no match exists in the list items).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType
member.summary: Specifies the type of content control.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.RichText
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be a rich text box when displayed in the document.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.Text
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be a plain text box when displayed in the document. This setting specifies that the behavior for this content control shall be as follows: Formatting applied to any part of this control contents shall apply to its entire contents. As well, the content control shall satisfy the following restraints: The contents shall only be contain a single run (one set of formatting properties) with exceptions for soft carriage returns via the property on this control. The contents shall not contain more than a single paragraph or table cell and shall not contain a table row or table.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.Picture
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be a picture when displayed in the document. This setting specifies that the behavior for this content control shall be as follows: The contents shall always be restricted to a single picture. As well, the content control shall satisfy the following restraints: The contents shall only be a single picture. The contents shall not contain more than a single paragraph or table cell and shall not contain a table row or table.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.ComboBox
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be a combo box when displayed in the document. This setting specifies that the behavior for this content control shall be as follows: The property specify choices which shall be displayed in a standard drop-down list format. Formatting applied to any part of this control contents shall apply to its entire contents. As well, the content control shall satisfy the following restraints: The contents shall only be contain a single run (one set of formatting properties). The contents shall not contain more than a single paragraph or table cell and shall not contain a table row or table.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.DropdownList
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be a drop-down list when displayed in the document. This setting specifies that the behavior for this content control shall be as follows: The contents shall not be editable when displayed by a hosting application regardless of the locking properties. The property specify choices which shall be displayed in a standard drop-down list format. As well, the content control shall satisfy the following restraints: The contents shall only be contain a single run (one set of formatting properties). The contents shall not contain more than a single paragraph or table cell and shall not contain a table row or table.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.BuildingBlockGallery
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be of a building block gallery type. This setting does not require or imply that the contents of control shall contain only the exact contents of a building block of the specified gallery and category which is present on the current machine, it shall only be used to specify that the content control is of this kind, which shall be used by an application to present the possible list of choices for insertion into the content control.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.BuildingBlock
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be of a building block type. This setting does not require or imply that the contents of the control shall contain only the exact contents of a buildin block of the specified gallery and category which is present on the current machine, it shall only be used to specify that the content control is of this kind, which shall be used by an application to present the possible list of choices for insertion into the content control. This type differs from the in that it can be used to semantically tag a set of block-level objects in a document without requiring the ability to specify a category and gallery of objects which can be swapped with it via the user interface. NOTE: This type is ignored by Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.Date
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be a date picker when displayed in the document. This setting specifies that the behavior for this content control shall be as follows: Formatting applied to any part of this control contents shall apply to its entire contents. As well, the content control shall satisfy the following restraints: The contents shall only be contain a single run (one set of formatting properties). The contents shall not contain more than a single paragraph or table cell and shall not contain a table row or table cell.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.Group
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be a restricted grouping when displayed in the document. This setting specifies that the behavior for this content control shall be as follows: The contents of this control shall not be editable when displayed by a hosting application regardless of the locking properties. This restriction can be superseded by any content control contained within the group, as each content control specifies the locking properties for its own content.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.CheckBox
member.summary: Specifies that the content control is a checkbox when displayed in the document. The control contents MUST contain a single character.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.Equation
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be of type equation. This setting does not require or imply that the contents of the structured document tag shall contain only an equation or associated placeholder text, it shall only be used to specify that the content control is of this kind, which can be used by an application as desired.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.Bibliography
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be of type bibliography. This setting does not require or imply that the contents of the content control shall contain only a field of type BIBLIOGRAPHY, it shall only be used to specify that the content control is of this kind, which can be used by an application as desired. NOTE: This type is ignored by Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.Citation
member.summary: Specifies that the content control shall be of type citation. This setting does not require or imply that the contents of the structured document tag shall contain only a field of type CITATION, it shall only be used to specify that the content control is of this type, which can be used by an application as desired. NOTE: This type is ignored by Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.RepeatingSection
member.summary: Specifies that the content control is a container for repeated items. The content control MUST contain only content controls with type. If is specified and the binding results in finding XML elements then the numerical relation between the number of elements matched and the number of child content controls contained MUST be maintained. NOTE: This type is ignored by Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.RepeatingSectionItem
member.summary: Specifies that the content control is a repeated item. The content control MUST be contained within a content control with type and MUST be either level , , or .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContentControlType.ExternalContentEntityPicker
member.summary: Specifies that the content control allows the user to select an instance of an external content type when displayed in the document. This setting specifies that the behavior for this content control shall be as follows: Formatting applied to any part of this control contents shall apply to its entire contents. As well, the content control shall satisfy the following restraints: The contents shall only be contain a single run (one set of formatting properties) with exceptions for soft carriage returns via the property on this control. The contents shall not contain more than a single paragraph or table cell and shall not contain a table row or table. The content control MUST specifiy property. The document MUST contain a custom XML data part whose root namespace is "http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/2006/metadata/properties", and whose identifier matches the value specified by the property. The property MUST specify the path to an element within that custom XML data part. The document MUST also contain a custom XML data part whose root namespace is "http://schemas.microsoft.com/office/2006/metadata/contentType". This custom XML data part contains a schema element (in the "http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" namespace) that specifies an XML Schema for the element specified by the property.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.XmlMapping.XPath
member.summary: Gets the XPath expression which shall be evaluated to find the custom XML node which is mapped to the content control. This XPath expression shall be specified using the syntax defined in the XML Path Language (XPath) Version 1.0 specification.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.XmlMapping.PrefixMappings
member.summary: Gets the set of prefix mappings which shall be used to interpret the XPath expression specified on the property when the XPath expression is evaluated against the custom XML data parts in the document. This property value shall be specified using the following syntax: xmlns:prefix='namespace', where prefix is the namespace prefix to be mapped, and namespace is the namespace to be mapped to the current prefix. Each prefix mapping shall be delimited by one or more whitespace characters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.XmlMapping.CustomXmlPartId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the which shall be used to evaluate the given property. If specified, then the XPath expression specified in the property shall only be evaluated against the custom XML part whose properties part has a matching identifier. If no custom XML part exists with a matching identifier, then the XML mapping shall not be connected. If value is null or empty, then the XPath expression shall be evaluated against each custom XML data part in turn until the given XPath expression is resolved to an XML node.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.XmlMapping.SupportRichTextControl
member.summary: Gets whether the xml mapping supports a content control with type. if false (default), the rich text content controls are not supported, so no data stored in the XML node is mapped for this kind of controls. if true, the data stored in the XML node will be an escaped string comprised of a flattened document representing the formatted data in the content control range.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RangeEditor
member.summary: Represent individual access holder.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.UserEditor
member.summary:
Specifies a single user for which this range permission shall be enabled (i.e. a user which shall be able to edit this range when document protection is enabled). This editor can be stored in one of the following forms:
DOMAIN\username - for users whose access shall be authenticated using the current user's domain credentials
user@domain.com - for users whose access shall be authenticated using the user's e-mail address as credentials
user - for users whose access shall be authenticated using the current user's machine credentials

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RangeBaseFindReplaceExtensions.Replace(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RangeBase,System.String,System.String,GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FindReplaceOptions)
member.summary:
In the current range, searches for a specified , and replaces it with a provided , using specified .
The can contain regular expressions (use to control this).
The following special tokens can be used in the and in the regardless of whether regex are on or off:
&pend of paragraph
&lmanual line break
&mpage break
&bsection break
To search for text with certain formatting, use and set the on it accordingly.
member.param: The current range.

The search pattern. May contain regular expressions, or be an empty string.
If empty, the search will be for any text with formatting that matches the passed in .

The replacement text.
If empty, the found text will be removed. can still be used to provide a replacement string.
If null, no replacement will occur, but and will still be called.
The search and replace options.
member.returns: The number of replaced occurrences.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RangeBaseFindReplaceExtensions.Find(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RangeBase,System.String,GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FindOptions)
member.summary:
In the current range, finds all occurrences of a specified , using specified .
The can contain regular expressions (use to control this).
The following special tokens can be used in the regardless of whether regex are on or off:
&pend of paragraph
&lmanual line break
&mpage break
&bsection break
To search for text with certain formatting, use and set the on it accordingly.
member.param: The current range.

The search pattern. May contain regular expressions, or be an empty string.
If empty, the search will be for any text with formatting that matches the passed in .
The search and replace options.
member.returns: The list of found occurrences.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ContinuationSeparatorMark
member.summary:
Represents a continuation separator mark within a run.
A continuation separator mark is a horizontal line that spans the width of the main story's text extents. The continuation separator mark is typically used within the context of continuation separator footnotes or endnotes. These footnote and endnote types define the footnote/endnote used to separate the contents of the main document story from continuation of footnotes or endnotes that began on a previous page.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PersistentRange
member.summary:
Represents a contiguous area of content objects in a document. Unlike , PersistentRange is kept alive and can be used even if the content used to create this range has been deleted.
Important: to avoid performance degradation, you should dispose PersistentRange when it is no longer needed.

member.summary: Range destructor, disposes allocated data.
member.remarks: It's good practice to don't wait destructor, instead execute method to dispose resources.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PersistentRange.Dispose
member.summary: Releases allocated range resources. Should be called once this range is no longer needed.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Run
member.summary:
Represents a contiguous fragment of a body content with uniform formatting.
Use to access the range of objects inside a run.
member.remarks: A run most commonly contains a single object, but it can also contain no or more than one texts and/or other objects.
member.example:
To get a string representing all text in a run:
string text = run.GetRange().Text;

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Tab
member.summary: Represents an absolute position tab element in a body content.
member.remarks:
An absolute position tab is a character that is used to advance the position on the current line of text when displaying content, using the following logic:
Regardless of any number of custom tab stops defined using the , the absolute position tab character shall advance to the position specified by its and properties.
The resulting end position of the tab character shall not be affected by the addition of any custom tab stops or changes to the value of the .
If the alignment location specified by the positional tab cannot be found on the current line because the starting location is past that point, then the tab character shall advance to that location on the next available line in the document.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.GcWordDocument.GetPropertyValueSource``1(System.Linq.Expressions.Expression{System.Func{``0}})
member.summary:
Gets the source of a formatting property.
This method finds and returns the object in the inheritance chain that determines the actual current value of the specified formatting property.
For example, to find the object that determines the font size of the first run in the document body:
var o = GetPropertyValueSource(() => document.Body.Runs.First.Font.Size);
In this example, if the Heading 1 style was applied to the paragraph containing that run, this method would return that style.
member.param: An expression that returns a property derived from the class.
member.returns:
If the property is inheritable, the object in the inheritance chain that explicitly specifies the property value, or null if the property value is not specified and the property has the default value.
If the property is not inheritable, the property owner is returned.

member.summary: Gets the list of gradient stops that specify the gradient colors and their relative positions in the color band.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.GradientFill.RotateWithObject
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the fill rotates along with the object when the object is rotated.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.GradientFill.Angle
member.summary:
Gets or sets the direction of color change for the gradient in degrees 0..360.
To define this angle, let its value be x measured clockwise.
Then ( -sin x, cos x ) is a vector parallel to the line of constant color in the gradient fill.
This property has effect only when the property is .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.GradientFill.AngleScaled
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the gradient angle scales with the fill region.
Mathematically, if this flag is true, then the gradient vector ( cos x , sin x ) is scaled by the width (w) and height (h) of the fill region, so that the vector becomes ( w cos x, h sin x ) (before normalization).
Observe that now if the gradient angle is 45 degrees, the gradient vector is ( w, h ), which goes from top-left to bottom-right of the fill region. If this flag is false, the gradient angle is independent of the fill region and is not scaled using the manipulation described above.
So a 45-degree gradient angle always give a gradient band whose line of constant color is parallel to the vector (1, -1).
This property has effect only when the property is .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.GradientFill.FillRectangle
member.summary:
Gets the "focus" rectangle for the center shade, specified relative to the fill tile rectangle.
The center shade fills the entire tile except the margins specified by each property.
Each edge of the center shade rectangle is defined by a percentage offset from the corresponding edge of the tile rectangle.
A positive percentage specifies an inset, while a negative percentage specifies an outset.
This property has NO effect if the property is .
member.example: A left offset of 25% specifies that the left edge of the center shade rectangle is located to the right of the tile rectangle's left edge by an amount equal to 25% of the tile rectangle's width.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.GradientFill.TileRectangle
member.summary:
Gets a rectangular region of the object to which the gradient is applied.
This region is then tiled across the remaining area of the object to complete the fill.
The tile rectangle is defined by percentage offsets from the sides of the shape's bounding box.
Each edge of the tile rectangle is defined by a percentage offset from the corresponding edge of the bounding box.
A positive percentage specifies an inset, while a negative percentage specifies an outset.
This property has effect if the property is or .
member.example: A left offset of 25% specifies that the left edge of the tile rectangle is located to the right of the bounding box's left edge by an amount equal to 25% of the bounding box's width.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.GradientFill.TileFlip
member.summary:
Gets or sets the direction(s) in which to flip the gradient while tiling.
Normally a gradient fill encompasses the entire bounding box of the object which contains the fill.
However, with the property, it is possible to define a "tile" rectangle which is smaller than the bounding box.
In this situation, the gradient fill is encompassed within the tile rectangle, and the tile rectangle is tiled across the bounding box to fill the entire area.
This property has effect if the property is or .

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageFillType.Stretch
member.summary: The image should be stretched to fill the target rectangle.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageFillType.Tile
member.summary:
The image should be tiled to fill the available space.
This value defines a "tile" rectangle within the bounding box.
The image is encompassed within the tile rectangle, and the tile rectangle is tiled across the bounding box to fill the entire area.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageCompression
member.summary:

This allows an application to specify the amount of compression that has been applied to a picture.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.Compression
member.summary: Gets or sets the image compression value.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.Crop
member.summary: Gets the portion of the image used for the fill.
member.remarks: Each edge of the source rectangle is defined by a percentage offset from the corresponding edge of the bounding box. A positive percentage specifies an inset, while a negative percentage specifies an outset. For example, a left offset of 25% specifies that the left edge of the source rectangle is located to the right of the bounding box's left edge by an amount equal to 25% of the bounding box's width.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.Stretch
member.summary:
Gets a stretch fill rectangle.
When stretching an image, the source rectangle is scaled to fit the specified fill rectangle.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image fill type.

member.summary: Gets the image tile format used to fill the available space.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.RotateWithObject
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the data rotates along with the object when the object is rotated.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.Dpi
member.summary:
Gets or sets the DPI (dots per inch) used to calculate the size of the image.
If zero, the DPI in the image is used.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.Transparency
member.summary: Gets or sets the degree of transparency of the image as a value between 0 (opaque) and 1 (clear).

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the picture has image bytes or links to an image.

member.summary: Sets the image that is displayed by this picture.

The content type of the image data.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.ToByteArray
member.summary:
Returns a byte array representing the image, regardless of whether the image is stored or linked.
If the image is linked, this method downloads the image each time it is called.
member.returns: The image bytes.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ImageData.ToStream
member.summary:
Creates and returns a stream containing the image bytes.
If the image bytes are stored in the picture, creates and returns a MemoryStream object.
If the image is linked and stored in a file, opens the file and returns a FileStream object.
If the image is linked and stored in an external URL, downloads the file and returns a MemoryStream object.
member.returns: A stream containing the image bytes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.StyleFill.ThemeFillIndex
member.summary:
Gets or sets the index of a fill style within the or .
A value of 0 or 1000 indicates no fill, values 1-999 refer to the index of a fill style within the , and values 1001 and above refer to the index of a background fill style within the .
The value 1001 corresponds to the first background fill style, 1002 to the second background fill style, and so on.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TileFill
member.summary:
Represents the picture tile fill.
Defines a "tile" rectangle within the bounding box.
The picture is encompassed within the tile rectangle, and the tile rectangle is tiled across the bounding box to fill the entire area.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TileFill.Alignment
member.summary:
Gets or sets where to align the first tile with respect to the shape.
Alignment happens after the scaling, but before the additional offset.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TileFill.Flip
member.summary:
Gets or sets the direction in which to flip the picture while tiling.
Pictures can be flipped horizontally, vertically, or in both directions to fill the entire region.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that implemented interface.
A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.summary: Initalizes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that implemented interface.
A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.
Parent base keys to synchronize formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.FrameEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the specified border should be modified to create a frame effect by reversing the border's appearance from the edge nearest the text to the edge furthest from the text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.Color
member.summary: Gets or sets the border color.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.LineStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the line style.
member.remarks: If you set the line style to none, the line width is automatically changed to zero. This border can either be an art border (a repeated image along the borders shall only be used for page borders) or a line border (a line format repeated along the borders).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.LineWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the border width in points.
member.remarks: If you set line width greater than zero when line style is none, the line style is automatically changed to single line.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.Shadow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the border has a shadow.
member.remarks: In Microsoft Word, for a border to have a shadow, the borders on all four sides should be of the same type, width, color and all should have the Shadow property set to true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.Space
member.summary:
Gets or sets the distance of the border from text or from the page edge in points.
Has no effect and will be automatically reset to zero for borders of table cells.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Border.Visible
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the border is visible.
If set to false, the the line style is is automatically changed to LineStyle.None.

member.summary: Resets border properties to default values.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.RGB
member.summary:
Gets or sets the RGB color value. The value indicates auto color. Only solid colors (with alpha 255) are supported.
If this property is set to a value other than , , and property values are removed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.ThemeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme color that should be applied to the current object.
member.remarks: The specified theme color is a reference to one of the predefined theme colors, located in the document themes, which allows for color information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.ThemeShade
member.summary: Gets or sets the shade value applied to the supplied theme color (if any) for this contents.
member.remarks: If the ThemeShade is supplied, then it is applied to the RGB value of the theme color to determine the final color applied to this contents.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.ThemeTint
member.summary: Gets or sets the tint value applied to the supplied theme color (if any) for this contents.
member.remarks: If the ThemeTint is supplied, then it is applied to the RGB value of the theme color to determine the final color applied to this contents.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WordColor.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default color formatting.
member.remarks: Removes all font formatting specified explicitly on the object from which Color was obtained so the color formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListLevel.NumberFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the number format for the list level.
member.remarks:
The percent sign (%) followed by any number from 1 through 9 represents the number style from the respective list level.
For example, if you wanted the format for the first level to be "Article I," "Article II," and so on, the string for the property would be "Article %1" and the property would be set to .
If the property is set to , the string for the property can only contain one character.

member.example: A value of ア indicates that a consumer must use Katakana numbering.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId
member.summary: Specifies predefined list templates available in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletDefault
member.summary: Default bulleted list with 9 levels. Bullet of the first level is a disc, bullet of the second level is a circle, bullet of the third level is a square. Then formatting repeats for the remaining levels. Each level is indented to the right by 18 points relative to the previous level. Corresponds to the 1st bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletCircle
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a circle. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 2nd bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletSquare
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a square. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 3rd bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletPicture
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a picture. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 3rd bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletDiamonds
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a 4-diamond Wingding character. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 5th bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletArrowHead
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is an arrow head Wingding character. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 6th bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.BulletTick
member.summary: The bullet of the first level is a tick Wingding character. The remaining levels are same as in BulletDefault. Corresponds to the 7th bulleted list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberDefault
member.summary: Default numbered list with 9 levels. Arabic numbering (1., 2., 3., ...) for the first level, lowecase letter numbering (a., b., c., ...) for the second level, lowercase roman numbering (i., ii., iii., ...) for the third level. Then formatting repeats for the remaining levels. Each level is indented to the right by 18 points relative to the previous level. Corresponds to the 1st numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberArabicParenthesis
member.summary: The number of the first level is "1)". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 2nd numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberUppercaseRomanDot
member.summary: The number of the first level is "I.". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 3rd numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberUppercaseLetterDot
member.summary: The number of the first level is "A.". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 4th numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberLowercaseLetterParenthesis
member.summary: The number of the first level is "a)". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 5th numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberLowercaseLetterDot
member.summary: The number of the first level is "a.". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 6th numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.NumberLowercaseRomanDot
member.summary: The number of the first level is "i.". The remaining levels are same as in NumberDefault. Corresponds to the 7th numbered list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineNumbers
member.summary: An outline list with levels numbered "1), a), i), (1), (a), (i), 1., a., i.". Corresponds to the 1st outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineLegal
member.summary: An outline list with levels are numbered "1., 1.1., 1.1.1, ...". Corresponds to the 2nd outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineBullets
member.summary: An outline lists with various bullets for different levels. Corresponds to the 3nd outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineHeadingsArticleSection
member.summary: An outline list with levels linked to Heading styles. Corresponds to the 4th outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineHeadingsLegal
member.summary: An outline list with levels linked to Heading styles. Corresponds to the 5th outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineHeadingsNumbers
member.summary: An outline list with levels linked to Heading styles. Corresponds to the 6th outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.BuiltInListTemplateId.OutlineHeadingsChapter
member.summary: An outline list with levels linked to Heading styles. Corresponds to the 7th outline list template in the Bullets and Numbering dialog box in Microsoft Word.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the list template.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.IsMultiLevel
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the list contains 9 levels, If this property is false, the list contains only 1 level.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.ListLevels
member.summary: Gets the collection of for the list template.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.StyleDefinition
member.summary: Gets a numbering style that this list template uses as the base numbering definition.
member.remarks: Numbering styles are never directly referenced by paragraphs or runs in the document. Instead, a list template specifies that it contains the underlying numbering information for a numbering style. The numbering style itself is just a friendly name on a list template.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.StyleReference
member.summary: Gets a numbering style that serves the actual numbering properties, and which itself points to the actual underlying list template.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.AbstractId
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique number that shall be used as the identifier for the abstract numbering definition of this list template.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.InitialAbstractId
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique ID for the abstract numbering definition of this list template. This number shall be identical for two abstract numbering definitions that are based from the same initial numbering definition if a document is repurposed and the underlying numbering definition is changed, it shall maintain its original InitialAbstractId.
member.remarks: This property can be used to determine the abstract numbering definition to be applied to a numbered paragraph copied from one document and pasted into another. Consider a case in which a given numbered paragraph associated with a abstract numbering definition 123, is pasted among numbered paragraphs associated with a completely different appearance and an abstract numbering definition 123. Here, because of the distinction enabled by the identical values, the hosting application would not have to arbitrarily keep the pasted numbered paragraph associated with its original abstract numbering definition, as it might use the information provided by the abstract numbering definition's identical values to know that those two numbering sets are identical, and merge the paragraphs into the target numbering format.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.Code
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique code that can be used to determine a location within application user interface in which this list template shall be displayed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.StyleDefinitionId
member.summary: Gets or sets that the list template is the base numbering definition for the specified referenced numbering style.
member.remarks: Numbering styles are never directly referenced by paragraphs or runs in the document instead, a list template specifies that it contains the underlying numbering information for a numbering style. The numbering style itself is just a friendly name on a list template. If this property is not defined, or it references a style that does not exist, then this list template shall not be the underlying properties for a numbering style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplate.StyleReferenceId
member.summary: Gets or sets that the list template does not contain the actual numbering properties, but rather serves as a reference to a numbering style stored in the document, that shall be applied when this list template is referenced, and itself points at the actual underlying list template to be used.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplateCollection.LastReviewedAbstractId
member.summary: Gets or sets to a consumer the progress in the last attempt made by the application to remove unused abstract definitions from the document. If a legacy document is opened by a consumer, it can choose to remove abstract definition which are 'orphaned' (have no associated numbering definition instances). This property is used by those consumers to indicate their progress (if not complete) in reviewing existing abstract numbering definitions.
member.remarks: Removing unused abstract numbering definition from a document reduces the file size, but is not required.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ListTemplateCollection.Abstracts
member.summary: Gets the array of abstracted list templates.
member.remarks: Each abstruct template specifies a set of properties which shall dictate the appearance and behavior of a set of numbered paragraphs in a document. These properties are collectively called an abstract numbering definition, and are the basis for all numbering information in a document. Although an abstract numbering definition contains a complete set of numbering, it shall not be directly referenced by content(hence the use of abstract). Instead, these properties shall be inherited by a numbering definition instance, which can then itself be referenced by content.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation
member.summary: Represents the set of indentation properties applied to a paragraph.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that implemented interface.
A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.AutoAdjustRightIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the right indent shall be automatically adjusted for the given paragraph when a document grid has been defined for the current section, modifying of the current right indent used on this paragraph.
member.remarks: This setting is used in order to ensure that the line breaking for that paragraph is not determined by the width of the final character on the line.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.CharacterUnitFirstLineIndent
member.summary: Returns or sets the value (in characters) for a first-line or hanging indent. Use a positive value to set a first-line indent, and use a negative value to set a hanging indent.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.CharacterUnitLeftIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the left indent value (in characters) for the specified paragraphs.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.CharacterUnitRightIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the right indent value (in characters) for the specified paragraphs.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.FirstLineIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value (in points) for a first line or hanging indent. Use a positive value to set a first-line indent, and use a negative value to set a hanging indent.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.LeftIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value (in points) that represents the left indent for paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.MirrorIndents
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the paragraph indents should be interpreted as mirrored indents.
member.remarks: When true, the start indent shall become the inside indent (the one closest to the binding) and the end indent shall become the outside indent (the one furthest from the binding). This mirroring is typically used when the contents of the document are used to generate signatures combinations of pages that are then placed in a binding. When signatures are printed in a left-to-right document, the first, third, etc. pages are printed on the left side of the combined sheet, and the second, fourth, etc. are printed on its right side, then bound and folded. For a right-to-left document, the first, third, etc. pages are printed on the right side of the combined sheet, and the second, fourth, etc. are printed on its left side.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.RightIndent
member.summary: Gets or sets the value (in points) that represents the right indent for paragraph.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Indentation.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default indent formatting.
member.remarks: Removes all indent formatting specified explicitly on the object from which Indent was obtained so the indent formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.PageBreakBefore

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ParagraphFormat.ConditionalStyleOptions
member.summary: Specifies the set of conditional table style formatting properties that have been applied to content.
member.remarks: This enumeration is an optimization that is used by consumers to determine if a given property on a content is the result of the table style conditional formatting properties vs. direct formatting on the table cell itself. It specifies the components of the conditional formatting in the table style applied to this content, so that the table's conditional formatting can be applied after the document is displayed without having the table style properties override the style hierarchy.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndAlpha
member.summary: Gets or sets whether inter-character spacing shall automatically be adjusted between regions of Latin text and regions of East Asian text in the current paragraph. These regions shall be determined by the Unicode character values of the text content within the paragraph.
member.remarks: This property is used to ensure that the spacing between regions of Latin text and adjoining East Asian text is sufficient on each side such that the Latin text can be easily read within the East Asian text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.AddSpaceBetweenFarEastAndDigit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether inter-character spacing shall automatically be adjusted between regions of numbers and regions of East Asian text in the current paragraph. These regions shall be determined by the Unicode character values of the text content within the paragraph.
member.remarks: This property is used to ensure that the spacing between regions of numbers and adjoining East Asian text is sufficient on each side such that the numbers can be easily read within the East Asian text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.LineSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the line spacing for the paragraph. If is Auto then value is interpreted in lines otherwise in points.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.LineSpacingRule
member.summary: Gets or sets the line spacing rule for the paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.NoSpaceBetweenParagraphsOfSameStyle
member.summary: When true, and will be ignored between the paragraphs of the same style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.LineUnitAfter
member.summary:
Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in gridlines) after the paragraph.
Has no effect when is true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.LineUnitBefore
member.summary:
Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in gridlines) before the paragraph.
Has no effect when is true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.SpaceAfter
member.summary:
Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in points) after the paragraph.
Has no effect when is true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.SpaceAfterAuto
member.summary:
True if the amount of spacing after the paragraph is set automatically.
When set to true, overrides the effect of .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.SpaceBefore
member.summary:
Gets or sets the amount of spacing (in points) before the paragraph.
Has no effect when is true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Spacing.SpaceBeforeAuto
member.summary:
True if the amount of spacing before the paragraph is set automatically.
When set to true, overrides the effect of .

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TabStopCollection.Clear
member.summary: Deletes all custom tab stops.
member.remarks: This method clears only tab stops that are not inherited from previous level of hirerachy. So after clearing some active tab stops might reamains from previous level of hirerachy. To stop propagation of active tab stops at that positions just add new tab stops with .

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TabStopCollection.Delete(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TabStop)
member.summary: Deletes a from the collection.
member.param: The to delete.
member.remarks: This method allows to delete only tab stops that are not inherited from previous level of hirerachy. So after deleting that might be another active tab stop at this position inherited from previous level of hirerachy. To stop propagation of active tab stops at this position just add a new tab stop with .

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.EastAsianLayout.HorizontalInVertical
member.summary: Gets or sets that characters in the run should be rendered with a 270 degree rotation to the left from all other contents of the line when displayed in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.EastAsianLayout.FitVerticalInLine
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the vertical text shall be compressed at display time in order to ensure that it fits into the existing line height without increasing the overall height of the line.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.EastAsianLayout.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique ID which shall be used to link multiple runs with to each other to ensure that their contents are correctly displayed in the document. ///
member.remarks: This means that multiple runs which are broken apart due to differences in formatting can be identified as belonging to the same grouping in terms of properties, although they are separated into multiple runs of text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Ligatures.Standard
member.summary: Applies standard ligatures to the font. Standard ligatures are designed to enhance readability. Standard ligatures in Latin languages include "fi", "fl", and "ff", for example.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Ligatures.Contextual
member.summary: Applies contextual ligatures to the font. Contextual ligatures are often designed to enhance readability, but may also be solely ornamental. Contextual ligatures may also be contextual alternates.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Ligatures.Historical
member.summary: Applies historical ligatures to the font. Historical ligatures are similar to standard ligatures in that they were originally intended to improve the readability of the font, but may look archaic to the modern reader.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Ligatures.Discretional

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font
member.summary: Represents font attributes (font name, size, color, and so on) for an object.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initalizes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that implemented interface.
A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.ContextualAlternates
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether contextual alternates are enabled for the font.
member.remarks: Contextual alternates are ligatures that are applied to individual characters based on the letters around them (their context). Contextual alternates can also be applied to entire words in certain contexts, for example, words frequently used in titles (such as "of" and "the"). When contextual alternates are enabled for a font, they are used instead of the standard ligatures in those contexts defined by the font designer.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.HighlightColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the highlight (marker) color.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.Ligatures
member.summary: Gets or sets ligatures that are two or more glyphs that are represented by what appears to the reader as a single character in order to create more readable or attractive text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.NumberForm
member.summary: Gets or sets the number form setting for an OpenType font.
member.remarks: Numbers in OpenType fonts can be displayed either with consistent heights along the baseline of the text (called "lining"), or with varying heights (called "hanging" or "old style") where numbers are displayed above or below the baseline of the text. Use the NumberForm property to specify whether numbers are displayed using lining or old-style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.NumberSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the number spacing setting for a font.
member.remarks: OpenType fonts support a proportional and tabular figure feature to control number spacing. Proportional number spacing handles each number as having a different width. For example, "1" is displayed as narrower than "5". Tabular number spacing handles numbers as equal in width so that they align vertically, which increases the readability, especially for financial information.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.RightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents shall have right-to-left characteristics.
member.remarks: This property, when on, shall not be used with strongly left-to-right text. Any behavior under that condition is unspecified. This property, when off, shall not be used with strong right-to-left text. Any behavior under that condition is unspecified. When the contents of this run are displayed, all characters shall be treated as complex script characters for formatting purposes. This means that BoldBi, ItalicBi, SizeBi and a corresponding font name will be used when rendering the content.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.StylisticSets
member.summary: Gets or sets the stylistic set for the specified font.
member.remarks: Some OpenType fonts provide stylistic sets. A stylistic set defines a set of characters within the font that are intended to be used together, usually for the purpose of visual harmony, such as in headings.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Font.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default font formatting.
member.remarks: Removes all font formatting specified explicitly on the object from which Font was obtained so the font formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.AllCaps
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as all capital letters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.AlwaysHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the given run shall always behave as if it is hidden, even when hidden text is being displayed in the current document.
member.remarks: This property shall only be used to specify that a paragraph mark shall never be used to break the end of a paragraph for display, even if it is being shown on the document, as would be the case if a regularly hidden paragraph was not being displayed in the document. This property was typically used to ensure that a paragraph style can be applied to a part of a paragraph, and still appear as in the Table of Contents (which in previous word processors would ignore the use of the style if it were being used as a character style. If this font property is applied to any other run, it can be ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Animation
member.summary: Gets or sets the font animation effect.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Bidi
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents shall be treated as complex script text regardless of their Unicode character values when determining the formatting. This means that a consumer shall use the complex script formatting (e.g. BoldBi, ItalicBi...) applied by this font when determining the resulting formatting properties.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Bold
member.summary: a value indicating whether the font is formatted as bold.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.BoldBi
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the bold property shall be applied to all complex script characters in the contents when displayed in a document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Border
member.summary: Gets the object that specifies borders for the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Color
member.summary: Gets the color of the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.DisableCharacterSpaceGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current run should use the document grid characters per line settings defined in the Document.Grid property when laying out the contents in this run. This setting determines whether the additional character pitch specified in the document grid shall be added to each character in this run as specified by the document grid.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.DoubleStrikeThrough
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as double strikethrough text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.EastAsianLayout
member.summary: Gets East Asian typography settings which shall be applied to the contents of the run.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Emboss
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as embossed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.EmphasisMark
member.summary: Gets or sets a constant that represents the emphasis mark for a character or designated character string.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Engrave
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as engraved.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.FitTextWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets that the contents of the run shall not be automatically displayed based on the width of its contents, rather its contents shall be resized to fit the width specified by the this property. This expansion/contraction shall be performed by equally increasing/decreasing the size of each character in the run's contents when displayed.
member.remarks: If the property value equals to 0, then the contents of the run shall be displayed based on the size of its contents.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.FitTextId
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique ID which shall be used to link multiple contiguous runs with specified property to each other to ensure that their contents are correctly merged into the specified width in the document. This means that multiple runs which are broken apart due to differences in formatting can be identified as belonging to the same grouping in terms of FitText properties, although they are multiple runs of text in the document.
member.remarks: If this property value equals to 0, then the run has no id and shall not be linked with any other run in the parent paragraph.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Hidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as hidden text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.HintType
member.summary: Gets or sets the font type that shall be used to format any ambiguous characters.
member.remarks: There are certain characters that are not explicitly stored in the document, and can be mapped into multiple categories of the four mentioned above. This property shall be used to arbitrate that conflict, and determine how ambiguities shall be handled. This is primarily used to handle the formatting on the paragraph mark glyph, and other characters that are not stored as text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Italic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as italic.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ItalicBi
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether shall be applied to all complex script characters in the contents when displayed in a document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Kerning
member.summary: Gets or sets the font size at which kerning starts.

member.summary: Gets or sets the locale name (language) of the formatted characters.

member.summary: Gets or sets the locale name (language) of the complex script characters.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the font is formatted as strikethrough text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.VerticalPosition
member.summary: Gets or set the alignment that shall be applied to the contents in relation to the default appearance of the text. This allows the text to be repositioned as subscript or superscript without altering the font size.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ThemeAscii
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme font that shall be used to format all characters in the Unicode range (U+0000U+007F) within the parent. This theme font is a reference to one of the predefined theme fonts, which allows for font information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ThemeBi
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme font that shall be used to format all characters in a complex script Unicode range. This theme font is a reference to one of the predefined theme fonts, which allows for font information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ThemeFarEast
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme font that shall be used to format all characters in an East Asian Unicode range. This theme font is a reference to one of the predefined theme fonts, which allows for font information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ThemeOther
member.summary: Gets or sets a theme font that shall be used to format all characters in a Unicode range that does not fall into one of the three categories defined above. This theme font is a reference to one of the predefined theme fonts, which allows for font information to be set centrally in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.Underline
member.summary: Gets or sets the type of underline applied to the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.UnderlineColor
member.summary: Gets the color of the underline applied to the font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.WebHidden
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents shall be hidden in a document when the document is being displayed in a web page view.
member.remarks: The setting should affect the normal display of text in a web page view, but an application can have settings to force hidden text to be displayed. As well, this setting should not affect a normal paginated view of the document.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontBase.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default font formatting.
member.remarks: Removes all font formatting specified explicitly on the object from which Font was obtained so the font formatting will be inherited from the appropriate parent.

member.summary: Gets the base formatting key for this class.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LayoutMode
member.summary: Specifies how text is laid out in the layout grid for a section.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LayoutMode.Default
member.summary: No grid is used to lay out text.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LayoutMode.Lines
member.summary: Text is laid out on a grid; the user specifies the number of lines, but not the number of characters per line.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LayoutMode.LinesAndChars
member.summary: Text is laid out on a grid; the user specifies the number of lines and the number of characters per line. As the user types, Microsoft Word doesn't automatically align characters with gridlines.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LayoutMode.SnapToChars
member.summary: Text is laid out on a grid; the user specifies the number of lines and the number of characters per line. As the user types, Microsoft Word automatically aligns characters with gridlines.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageGrid
member.summary: Represents the settings for a page grid, which enables precise layout of full-width East Asian language characters within a section by specifying the desired number of characters per line and lines per page for all East Asian text content in section.
