member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering
member.summary: Represents page numbering settings for all page numbers that appear in the contents of a section.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.IncludeChapterNumber
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a chapter number is included with page numbers or a caption label.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.ChapterPageSeparator
member.summary:
Gets or sets the separator character used between the chapter number and the page number.
If the property is 0, or its specified heading level does not have an associated numbering format, this value is ignored, since no chapter number is output by the field.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.HeadingLevelForChapter
member.summary:
Gets or sets the one-based index of the heading style applied to chapter titles in the document, to be used as chapter headings in all page numbers for a section, by locating the nearest heading of that style and extracting the numbering information.
Can be a number from 0 through 8, corresponding to heading levels 1 through 9.
member.remarks: If the specified heading style does not exist in the current section, or does not have a numbering format, then any previous level heading format shall be used as needed as the specified chapter number. If no heading has numbering information and/or is used in the section, then the chapter and chapter separator shall be omitted from the page numbering data.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.NumberStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the page number format.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.StartingNumber
member.summary:
Gets or sets the starting page number of a section.
The property, if set to false, will override this property so that page numbering can continue from the previous section.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.PageNumbering.RestartPageNumbering
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether page numbering restarts at the beginning of a section.
If false, overrides the property so that page numbering can continue from the previous section.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapeHorizontalPosition.Alignment
member.summary:
Gets or sets the relative horizontal alignment position of a shape.
If is , this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapeHorizontalPosition.Offset
member.summary:
Gets or sets the horizontal offset in points or percent according to the property value.
For nested shapes this property value is always relative to the parent shape's .
If the shape is not nested and is , this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.summary: Represents the properties used to position a shape in a document.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that implemented interface.
A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.AllowOverlap
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a shape that intersects another shape at display time is allowed to overlap the content of the other shape. If the shape cannot overlap another shape, it shall be repositioned when displayed to prevent this overlap as needed.
If is , this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.Horizontal
member.summary: Gets the horizontal position of a floating shape within a document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.LayoutInCell
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether a shape is positioned relative to a cell.
If is , this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.
When this property is true, the shape is positioned within the existing table cell, causing the cell to be resized as needed. This means that all positioning is relative to the cell and not the line on which the table appears.
When this property is false, the shape is positioned as specified, but the table is resized and/or relocated within the document as needed to accommodate the object. This means that all positioning shall be relative to the line on which the table appears and not the cell in which the anchor is present.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.LockAnchor
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the anchor location for a shape shall not be modified at runtime when an application edits the contents of this document.
If is , this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.
An application might have automatic behaviors that reposition the anchor for a shape based on user interaction - for example, moving it from one page to another as needed. This property must tell applications not to perform any such behaviors.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.Vertical
member.summary: Gets the vertical position of a floating shape within a document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapePosition.ZOrder
member.summary:
Gets or sets the relative Z-order of a shape in a document.
If is , this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.
Each floating shape has a Z-ordering value that determines which shape is displayed when any two objects intersect. Higher values indicate higher Z-order; lower values indicate lower Z-order.
This property only indicates the Z-order with respect to other shapes in the document that have an identical value. All shapes with a value of false are displayed above elements with a value of true.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ShapeSize.EffectExtent
member.summary:
Gets the additional extent that is added to each edge of a shape (top, bottom, left, right) in order to compensate for any drawing effects applied to the shape.
If the shape is nested inside another shape, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently ungrouped.
member.remarks: The and properties specify the size of the actual shape; however, an object can have effects applied that change its overall size, for example a reflection and/or shadow effect. The additional size for each edge of the shape is stored in this property, and used to calculate the appropriate wrapping for wrap types without a wrapping polygon and the appropriate line height for inline objects.

member.summary: The text is vertical. Each line is rotated clockwise 90 degrees. Text goes from top to bottom. Each next line is to the left of the previous one.

member.summary: The text is vertical. Each line is rotated clockwise 270 degrees. Text goes from bottom to top. Each next line is to the right of the previous one.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextOrientation.MongolianVertical
member.summary: A special version of vertical text, where some fonts are displayed as if rotated by 90 degrees while some fonts (mostly East Asian) are displayed vertical. The difference between this and is that text flows from top down, then from left to right (instead of from right to left).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextOrientation.WordArtRightToLeft
member.summary: Similar to , but the flow is from right to left rather than from left to right.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.FitShapeToText
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating that a shape should be auto-fit to fully contain the text described within it.
Auto-fitting is when text within a shape is scaled in order to contain all the text inside.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.Margin
member.summary:
Gets the insets of the bounding rectangle.
Insets are used just as internal margins for text frame within shapes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.NoTextRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether text should remain upright, regardless of the transform applied to it and the accompanying shape transform.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets how the text within the given text body should be displayed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.VerticalAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical anchoring position of the text frame within the shape.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to wrap words within the bounding rectangle.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.WrapFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets how text frame transform a text.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.Column
member.summary: Gets the text column properties in the text frame.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.DirectOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets direct value how the text within the given text body should be displayed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.NormalEastAsianFlow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to ignore the property. If true, the property is ignored, and text flows oriented horizontally, flowing from top to bottom vertically.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.CompatibleLineSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets that the line spacing for this text frame is decided in a simplistic manner using the font scene.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.ForceAntiAlias
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to force the text to be rendered anti-aliased regardless of the font size. Certain fonts can appear grainy around their edges unless they are anti-aliased. Therefore this property allows for the specifying of which bodies of text should always be anti-aliased and which ones should not.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.FromWordArt
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text within this text frame is converted text from a WordArt object. This is more of a backwards compatibility attribute that is useful to the application from a tracking perspective. WordArt was the former way to apply text effects and therefore this property is useful in document conversion scenarios.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.HorizontalAnchor
member.summary: Gets or sets the centering of the text frame. The way it works fundamentally is to determine the smallest possible "bounds box" for the text and then to center that "bounds box" accordingly. This is different than paragraph alignment, which aligns the text within the "bounds box" for the text. This property is compatible with all of the different property values.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.HorizontalOverflow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text can flow out of the bounding box horizontally. This is used to determine what happens in the event that the text within a frame is too large for the bounding box it is contained within.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.NoAutoFit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text within the text frame should not be auto-fit to the bounding box. Auto-fitting is when text within a text box is scaled in order to remain inside the text frame.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the rotation that is being applied to the text within the bounding box. If it is 0, the rotation of the accompanying shape is used.If it is not 0, then this is applied independently from the shape. That is the shape can have a rotation applied in addition to the text itself having a rotation applied to it

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.VerticalOverflow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text can flow out of the bounding box vertically. This is used to determine what happens in the event that the text within a shape is too large for the bounding box it is contained within.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TextFrameFormat.UseFirstLastParagraphSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the before and after paragraph spacing defined by the user is to be respected. While the spacing between paragraphs is helpful, it is additionally useful to be able to set a flag as to whether this spacing is to be followed at the edges of the text body, in other words the first and last paragraphs in the text body. More precisely since this is a text body level property it should only effect the before paragraph spacing of the first paragraph and the after paragraph spacing of the last paragraph for a given text body.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType
member.summary: Specifies the wrap type of a shape.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.Inline
member.summary: The shape is inline with the text, and affects the line height and layout of its line (like a character glyph of similar size)

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.None
member.summary:
The shape does not cause any text wrapping within the document contents based on its display location. In effect, this value places the shape in one of two locations:
If the property is true, then the shape is positioned behind the text as it is normally displayed.
If the property is false, then the shape is positioned in front of the text as it is normally displayed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.Square
member.summary: Text wraps around a virtual rectangle bounding the shape.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.Through
member.summary: Text wraps around the wrapping polygon bounding the shape and it allows text to wrap within the shape's maximum left and right extents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.Tight
member.summary: Text wraps around the wrapping polygon bounding the shape and it does not allow text to wrap within the shape's maximum left and right extents.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapType.TopBottom
member.summary: Text wraps around the top and bottom of the shape, but not around its left or right edges.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide
member.summary: Specifies how text wraps around the sides of a shape.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide.Both
member.summary: Text wraps on both sides of the shape.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide.Left
member.summary: Text wraps on the left side of the shape only.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide.Right
member.summary: Text wraps on the right side of the shape only.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapSide.Largest
member.summary: Text wraps on the side of the shape that is farthest from the page margin.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.NotSupportedByWrapTypeException
member.summary: Exception that is thrown if the current shape's does not support this property.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.NotSupportedByWrapTypeException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat
member.summary: Represents the properties for wrapping text around a shape or shape range.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that implemented interface.
A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.BehindText
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a floating shape is displayed behind the text of the document when the document is displayed. When a shape is displayed within a document, that shape can intersect with text in the document. This property determines whether the text or the object is rendered on top in case of overlapping.
member.remarks: If property is not None, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.DistanceBottom
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance that is maintained between the bottom edge of a shape and any subsequent text within the document when this shape is displayed within the document's contents.
member.remarks: If property is Inline or None, then this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.DistanceLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance that is maintained between the left edge of the shape and any subsequent text within the document when this shape is displayed within the document's contents.
member.remarks: If property is Inline or None or TopBottom, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.DistanceRight
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance that is maintained between the right edge of the shape and any subsequent text within the document when this shape is displayed within the document's contents.
member.remarks: If property is Inline or None or TopBottom, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.DistanceTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance that is maintained between the top edge of the shape and any subsequent text within the document when this shape is displayed within the document's contents.
member.remarks: If property is Inline or None, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object, but can be maintained and used if the object is subsequently changed to floating.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.Side
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the document text wraps on both sides of a shape, on either the left or right side only, or on the side of the shape that is farthest from the page margin.
member.remarks: If property is not Inline or None or TopBottom, his value does not have any effect when displaying the object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the wrap type of a shape.
member.remarks: For nested shapes this property value is always Inline.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.WrapPolygon
member.summary: Gets or sets the wrapping polygon that is used to determine the extents to which text can wrap around the shape in the document.
member.remarks: If property is not Through or not Tight, this value does not have any effect when displaying the object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.WrapFormat.IsNestedShape
member.summary: Gets whether the shape is nested inside another shape.

member.summary: Provides the properties which shall be applied to a single latent style for this document. Latent styles refer to any set of known style definitions which have not been included in the current document.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LatentStyle.Locked
member.summary: Gets or sets whether an application shall prevent the use of this style when this document is loaded and/or modified. If true then this style can be used to format existing content (i.e. any content which references this style shall have its properties as normal), but new instances of the style shall be prevented from being applied via all mechanisms associated with that application.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LatentStyle.QuickStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this style shall be treated as a primary style when this document is loaded by an application. If true then this style has been designated as being particularly important for the current document, and this information can be used by an application in any means desired.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LatentStyle.UnhideWhenUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether this style should not be displayed in any main user interface associated with an application which processes this document until it is referenced by document content.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.LatentStyle.Priority
member.summary: A number which can be used to sort the set of style definitions in a user interface.

member.summary: Gets or set an index in latent style collection order where styles are saving.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether an application shall automatically modify this style when the contents of an entire paragraph in the document with this style applied are modified, ensuring that although only a single instance of text with this style was modified, that change is stored on the style and therefore propagated to all locations where the style is in use.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.InUse
member.summary: Get a value indicating whether the built-in style has been modified or applied in the document or it is a new style that has been created in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Linked
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether a style is a linked style that can be used for both paragraph and character formatting.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.LinkStyle
member.summary:
Gets the style linked to the current style.
Styles can be paired to comprise a linked style.
A linked style is a grouping of a paragraph style and a character style that is used in a user interface to allow the same set of formatting properties to be applied.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.ListTemplate
member.summary:
Gets the that defines list formatting for the list style.
This property is only valid for list styles. For other style types this property returns null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.ListFormat
member.summary:
Get a list formatting for the paragraph style.
This property is only valid for paragraph styles. For other style types this property returns null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Locked
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether an application shall prevent the use of this style when this document is loaded and/or modified.
If true, this style can be used to format existing content (i.e. any content that references this style shall have its properties as normal), but new instances of the style shall be prevented from being applied via all mechanisms associated with that application.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.NextParagraphStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style to be applied automatically to a new paragraph inserted after a paragraph formatted with the specified style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.ParagraphFormat
member.summary: Gets the paragraph formatting of the style.
member.remarks: For character and list styles this property returns null.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Priority
member.summary: A number that can be used to sort the set of style definitions in a user interface.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.RevisionId
member.summary:
Gets or sets unique identifiers used to track style editing session.
A producer can choose to increment the revision save ID value to indicate subsequent editing (editing between save actions) to indicate the order of the saves performed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Table
member.summary: Gets a object representing properties that can be applied to a table using a table style.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Type
member.summary: Gets the style type.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Visibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the style visibility in application user interface.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.UnhideWhenUsed
member.summary:
Gets or sets a value indicating whether shall be reset when this style is used by the content of the document.
If true, an application shall ensure that even if the is that this property should be considered as if the style is referenced by any content in the document.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Style.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the style from the document.
member.remarks:
Style removal has following effects on the document model:
All references to the style are removed from corresponding paragraphs, runs and tables.
If a base style is removed, its formatting is moved to child styles.
If the style to be deleted has a linked style, then both styles are deleted.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyle.ColumnStripe
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns that shall comprise each a table style column band for this table style. This property determines how many columns constitute each of the column bands for the current table, allowing column band formatting to be applied to groups of columns (rather than just single alternating columns) when the table is formatted.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyle.RowStripe
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows that shall comprise each a table style row band for this table style. This property determines how many rows constitute each of the row bands for the current table, allowing row band formatting to be applied to groups of rows (rather than just single alternating rows) when the table is formatted.

member.summary: Do not use this constructor for this class directly, use it only in derived classes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of an inline table in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.AllowBreakAcrossPages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the content within the cells can be rendered on multiple pages.
member.remarks: When displaying the contents of a table cell, it is possible that a page break would fall within the contents of a table cell, causing the contents of that cell to be displayed across two different pages. If this property is false, then all contents of a table row shall be rendered on the same page by moving the start of the current row to the start of a new page if necessary. If the contents of this table row cannot fit on a single page, then this row shall start on a new page and flow onto multiple pages as necessary.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.HeadingFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a table row shall be repeated at the top of each new page on which part of this table is displayed. This gives this table row the behavior of a 'header' row on each of these pages.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Indent
member.summary: Gets or sets the indentation (in points) that shall be added before the leading edge of the current table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Padding
member.summary: Gets the default paddings for all cells in the current table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Shading
member.summary: Gets the shading that shall be applied to the extents of a table. Similarly to paragraph shading, this shading shall be applied to the contents of the tab up to the table borders, regardless of the presence of text - unlike cell shading, table shading shall include any cell padding. This property shall be superseded by any cell-level shading.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.Spacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the default amount of space (in points) between the cells.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableStyleBase.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of text in cells.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initialzes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that implemented interface.
A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.Borders
member.summary: Gets the collection of borders of a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.FitText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to fit text in a cell, compressing each paragraph to the width of the cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.HorizontalMerge
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying how a cell is merged horizontally with other cells in the row.
member.remarks: This property is maintained for compatibility with legacy word documents that defined tables in this manner. Whenever possible, this form or horizontal merges should not be used, and should be translated to the appropriate property instead.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.Padding
member.summary: Gets the cell paddings for a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred width of a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.TextFlowDirection
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of text in a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.Shading
member.summary: Gets shading formatting for a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of text in a cell.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.VerticalMerge
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying how a cell is merged with other cells vertically.
member.remarks: Cells can only be merged vertically if their left and right boundaries are identical. When cells are vertically merged, the display areas of the merged cells are consolidated. The consolidated area is used to display the contents of the first vertically merged cell and all other vertically merged cells must be empty.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.WordWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to wrap text in a cell.
member.remarks: This property only affects the behavior of the cell when the for this table is set to true. This property shall be interpreted in the context of the property as follows: If the table cell width is fixed, then this property specifies that that this table cell shall never be smaller than that fixed value when other cells on the line are not at their absolute minimum width. If the table cell width is relatuve or auto, then this property specifies that when running the auto fit algorithm, the contents of that this table cell shall be treated as though they have no breaking characters (the contents should be treated as a single contiguous non - breaking string).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.GridSpan
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of grid columns in the parent table's table grid that shall be spanned by the current cell. This property allows cells to have the appearance of being merged, as they span vertical boundaries of other cells in the table.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.ClearFormatting
member.summary: Resets to default cell formatting.

member.summary: Creates a copy of the instance.

member.returns: A new instance.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CellFormat.ConditionalStyleOptions
member.summary: Specifies the set of conditional table style formatting properties that have been applied to content.
member.remarks: This enumeration is an optimization that is used by consumers to determine if a given property on a content is the result of the table style conditional formatting properties vs. direct formatting on the table cell itself. It specifies the components of the conditional formatting in the table style applied to this content, so that the table's conditional formatting can be applied after the document is displayed without having the table style properties override the style hierarchy.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat
member.summary: Represents formatting for a table row.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initialzes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that implemented interface.
A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.Alignment
member.summary: Gets or sets a value specifying how the table row is aligned in the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.AllowBreakAcrossPages
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the contents within the current cell can be split between pages.
member.remarks: When displaying the contents of a table cell, it is possible that a page break would fall within the contents of a table cell, causing the contents of that cell to be displayed across two different pages. If this property is false, then all contents of a table row shall be rendered on the same page by moving the start of the current row to the start of a new page if necessary. If the contents of this table row cannot fit on a single page, then this row shall start on a new page and flow onto multiple pages as necessary.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.HeadingFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the current table row shall be repeated at the top of each new page on which part of this table is displayed. This gives this table row the behavior of a 'header' row on each of these pages. This property can be applied to any number of rows at the top of the table structure in order to generate multi-row table headers.
member.remarks: If false, this table row shall not be repeated on each new page on which the table is displayed. As well, if this row is not contiguously connected with the first row of the table (that is, if this table row is not either the first row, or all rows between this row and the first row are not marked as header rows) then this property shall be ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the table row in points.
member.remarks: The meaning of the value is defined based on the value of the value for this table row as follows: If the value of is , then the table row height should be automatically determined based on the height of its contents. This value is ignored. If the value of is , then the table row's height should be at least the value of this property. If the value of is , then the table row's height should be exactly the value of this property.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.HeightRule
member.summary: Gets or sets the rule for determining the height of the table row.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.Spacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the default amount of space (in points) between the cells.

member.summary: Resets to default row formatting.

member.summary: Creates a copy of the instance.

member.summary: Gets the base table formatting properties for this row.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.RowFormat.ConditionalStyleOptions
member.summary: Specifies the set of conditional table style formatting properties that have been applied to content.
member.remarks: This enumeration is an optimization that is used by consumers to determine if a given property on a content is the result of the table style conditional formatting properties vs. direct formatting on the table cell itself. It specifies the components of the conditional formatting in the table style applied to this content, so that the table's conditional formatting can be applied after the document is displayed without having the table style properties override the style hierarchy.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableFormat.Bidi
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cells in this table shall be visually represented in a right to left direction. This property also affects the application of all table-level properties. When this property is specified, then the ordering of all cells (and table-level properties) in this table shall be applied to the table assuming that the table is a normal left to right table, but the table cells shall be displayed in a right to left direction.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableFormat.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableFormat.Position
member.summary:
Gets the position of the table with regard to floating tables.
This property has effect only if is true.

member.summary: Gets or sets the table title.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current table is actually a floating table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TableFormat.TableGrid
member.summary: Gets the table grid for the current table. The table grid is a definition of the set of grid columns that define all of the shared vertical edges of the table, as well as default widths for each of these grid columns. These grid column widths are then used to determine the size of the table based on the table layout algorithm.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TablePosition
member.summary: Represents information about the current table with regard to floating tables. Floating tables are tables in a document which are not part of the main text flow in the document, and are instead absolutely positioned with a specific size and position relative to non-frame content in the current document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TablePosition.AllowOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current table shall allow other floating tables to overlap its extents when the tables are displayed in a document. If true, then no adjustment shall be made to prevent tables whose properties would normally cause them to overlap from overlapping when displayed. If false, then the tables shall be adjusted as needed to prevent them from overlapping when displayed by adjusting the floating table properties as needed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.TablePosition.Distance
member.summary: Gets the minimum distance which shall be maintained between the current floating table and text in the text in the paragraphs which are around this floating table.

member.summary: Gets the horizontal positioning of the current floating table within a document.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FontScheme
member.summary:
Represents a font scheme within a theme.
The font scheme consists of a pair of major and minor fonts for which to use in a document. The major font corresponds well with the heading areas of a document, and the minor font corresponds well with the normal text or paragraph areas.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.FormatScheme
member.summary:
Represents the background fill styles, effect styles, fill styles, and line styles which define the style matrix for a theme.
The style matrix consists of subtle, moderate, and intense fills, lines, and effects.
The background fills are not generally thought of to directly be associated with the matrix, but do play a role in the style of the overall document.
Usually, a given object chooses a single line style, a single fill style, and a single effect style in order to define the overall final look of the object.

member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the font that is to be used. The font name should be used in rendering the presentation. If this font is not available within the font list of the generating application than font substitution logic should be utilized in order to select an alternative font.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.ThemeFont.Charset
member.summary: Gets or sets the character set that is supported by the font. This information can be used in font substitution logic to locate an appropriate substitute font when this font is not available. This information is determined by querying the font when present and shall not be modified when the font is not available.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Panose-1 classification number for the current font using the mechanism defined in 4.2.7.17 of ISO/IEC 14496-22:2007.

member.summary: Contains compatibility options.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.IFormatting,System.String)
member.summary: Initailizes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An object that implemented interface.
A parent key for the formatting properties in this object.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.AdjustLineHeightInTable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to adjust line height to grid height in the table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.AlignTablesRowByRow
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to align table rows independently.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.AllowSpaceOfSameStyleInTable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow space between paragraphs of the same style in a table.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.ApplyBreakingRules
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use legacy ethiopic and amharic line breaking rules.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.AutofitToFirstFixedWidthCell
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to allow table columns to exceed preferred widths of constituent cells.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.AutoSpaceLikeWord95
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to emulate Word 95 full-width character spacing.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.BalanceSingleByteDoubleByteWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to balance single byte and double byte characters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.CachedColumnBalance
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use cached paragraph information for column balancing.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.CompatibiltyMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the document compatibility mode.
member.remarks: Use this property to prevent Microsoft Word from displaying "Compatibility mode" ribbon upon document loading.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.ConvertMailMergeEscape
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to treat backslash quotation delimiter as two quotation marks.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DisplayHangulFixedWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to always use fixed width for Hangul characters.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotAutofitConstrainedTables
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't autofit tables next to wrapped objects.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotBreakConstrainedForcedTable
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't break table rows around floating tables.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotBreakWrappedTables
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't break wrapped tables across pages.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotExpandShiftReturn
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't justify lines ending in soft line break.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotLeaveBackslashAlone
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to display backslash as yen sign.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotSnapToGridInCell
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't snap text to grid inside table with inline objects.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotSuppressIndentation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't ignore floating objects when calculating paragraph indentation.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotSuppressParagraphBorders
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't suppress paragraph borders next to frames.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotUseEastAsianBreakRules
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't compress compressible characters when using document grid.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotUseHTMLParagraphAutoSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use fixed paragraph spacing for html auto setting.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotUseIndentAsNumberingTabStop
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to ignore hanging indent when creating tab stop after numbering.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotVerticallyAlignCellWithShape
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't vertically align cells containing floating objects.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotVerticallyAlignInTextBox
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to ignore vertical alignment in textboxes.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.DoNotWrapTextWithPunctuation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to don't allow hanging punctuation with character grid.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.FootnoteLayoutLikeWord8
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to emulate Word 6.x/95/97 footnote placement.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.ForgetLastTabAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to ignore width of last tab stop when aligning paragraph if it is not left aligned.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.CompatibilityOptions.GrowAutofit

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection
member.summary: Represents the set of document protection restrictions applied to a document.
member.remarks: These restrictions should be enforced by applications editing this document when the IsActive property is turned on, and ignored (but persisted) otherwise. Document protection is a set of restrictions used to prevent unintentional changes to all or part of a document. This protection does not encrypt the document, and malicious applications might circumvent its use. This protection is not intended as a security feature.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Settings)
member.summary: Construct DocumentProtection element.
member.param: Setting object that hosts DocumentProtection instance.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection.#ctor(GrapeCity.Documents.Word.Settings,GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection)
member.summary: Copy constructor with additional parent parameter. Deep copying.
member.param: Parent settings object
Source DocumentProtection object

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection.WritePassword
member.summary: Gets or sets the write password.
member.remarks: When present, the write protection shall result in one of two write protection behaviors: If the Password property is present, or both (WritePassword and ReadOnlyRecommended properties) are omitted, then the application shall prompt for a password to exit write protection. If the supplied password does not match the hash value in this property, then write protection shall be enabled. If only the ReadOnlyRecommended property is present, the application should provide user interface recommending that the user open this document in write protected state.If the user chooses to do so, the document shall be write protected, otherwise, it shall be opened fully editable.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection.EditProtection
member.summary: Specifies the type of editing restrictions which shall be enforced on the document.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection.ReadOnlyRecommended
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether read-only mode is recommended when opening the document.
member.remarks: Specifies that applications should provide user interface recommending that the user open this document in write protected state. If the user chooses to do so, the document shall be write protected, otherwise, it shall be opened fully editable. If this property is omitted, then user interface recommending that the user open this document in write protected state should not be provided. If the password property is also specified, then this setting shall be ignored.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection.MarkAsFinal
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the document is marked as final (read-only).
member.remarks: Use this property to make your file read-only. When you mark as final, typing, editing commands, proofing marks are disabled or turned off, and the file becomes read-only, and the Status property of the document is set to Final.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection.BlockThemeOrSchemeSwitching
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether modification of the document's theme information should be blocked.
member.remarks: Specifies whether applications shall prevent the modification of the document's theme information stored in the Theme part when editing this document. This setting should not preclude the use of the theme information, instead, it should only prevent the modification of the theme part in a single operation (either through a user interface or a programmatic operation).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.DocumentProtection.BlockQuickStylesetSwitching
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the replacement of the complete set of the document's styles should be blocked.
member.remarks: Specifies whether applications shall prevent the replacement of the complete set of styles stored in the Styles part when editing this document. This setting should not preclude the editing or removal of individual styles, instead, it should only prevent the removal and replacement of the entire styles part in a single operation (either through a user interface or a programmatic operation).

member.name: T:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.JustificationMode
member.summary: Specifies how full-width characters in the current document should be compressed to remove additional whitespace when the contents of this document are displayed, specifically by specifying the set(s) of characters which can be compressed to remove additional whitespace.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.EastAsianTypography.NoLineBreakAfter
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of characters which shall be restricted from ending a new line for runs of text which shall be subject to custom line breaking logic using the when the contents of the document are displayed. member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.EastAsianTypography.NoLineBreakAfterLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the language of text for which the custom line ending rule shall be applied.
member.remarks: Applications supporting this functionality shall support custom line breaking for the following four languages: Chinese(Traditional), Chinese(Simplified), Japanese, Korean. Applications can also support custom line breaking rules for other languages, but this is not required.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.EastAsianTypography.NoLineBreakBefore
member.summary: Gets or sets the set of characters which shall be restricted from beginning a new line for runs of text which shall be subject to custom line breaking logic using the when the contents of the document are displayed. This constraint shall only apply to text which has been flagged in the language of this rule via the or automatic detection methods.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.Documents.Word.EastAsianTypography.NoLineBreakBeforeLanguage
member.summary: Gets or sets the language of text for which the custom line beginning rule shall be applied.
member.remarks: Applications supporting this functionality shall support custom line breaking for the following four languages: Chinese(Traditional), Chinese(Simplified), Japanese, Korean. Applications can also support custom line breaking rules for other languages, but this is not required.

member.remarks: This property is a mechanism used by legacy documents to store the digital signature of its binary representation, and should be avoided in favor of the well-defined mechanism. Any use of this property should be for legacy compatibility only, and is application-defined.

member.name: T:DocumentFormat.OpenXml.EnumStringLookup`1
member.summary: A utility to parse the and attributes on schema related enums. Performance profiling shows that iterating through each of the types every time this is needed is very detrimental for performance. This creates an instance of a lookup table and caches it on the initial call
member.typeparam: The type of the enum
member.remarks: Calls will throw when has the following characteristics: - Does not have as an underlying type - Has custom values that are not in the range of [0, {EnumSize}] - Does not have an for each member - Has no members

member.summary: Custom implementation of IsDefined to minimize performance impact on many calls
